After the first 15 days the volume stopped for all videos and resetting Chromecast didn't fix the problem.  Google's help page is terrible and there is no help on how to fix it.  If you are curious buy it but expect it to stop working. Google once again proving, they are unable to create a working hardware.

review: The chromecast couldn't be easier to set up and start casting from just about any device capable of running it.  The $35 price tag also can't be beat.Unfortunately, I choose to stream the majority of my media from Amazon Prime, and would also appreciate the ability to just stream an image of my desktop to the TV.  The chromecast isn't currently capable of doing either of those things. My chromecast ended up being something more of a novelty to me and I just haven't found a consistent use for it in my house.  Even if the capability existed to cast from the Amazon Ap, I'd still be tying up one of my devices to cast to the TV.  A basic Roku box is similarly priced and doesn't need one of my $500+ mobile devices to make it work.Lastly, the Chromecast sticks out pretty far from the HDMI port and the flimsy Micro-USB power cord sticks out even farther... You've got to be careful not to slide your TV around anywhere the back of the chromecast might hit against.  I've accidentally squished the chromecast against a wall with a wall mounted monitor and again against the  TV stand at my parent's house. Now the Micro-USB power cord is bent and is difficult to get situated in the socket on the Chromecast.  I'm afraid if I do it once or twice more it will break off entirely.  Not ideal if you plan on using the Chromecast as a "portable" solution that you can carry with you to plug into a variety of displays.Bottom line:  A very cool bit of tech at a nice price, but ultimately useless at my house.
author: Jamie Ziegler

review: Update. 3 months later, this device still doesn't work on my downstairs TV. Google of course has not addressed such issues, so if it works, great, if it doesn't, you're on your own. Skip this and check out EZcast; it works much better and isn't locked down like this device.This device is still in the premature stages. It doesn't work with all HDMI ports on all TVs. On mine it works with one tv's HDMI ports, but not the other TV. It's a problem, and there is no support from Google on this. The casting is pretty basic at this point, you can't even cast the movies you made using your phone/tablet camera. Basically you are locked into casting only "bought" media, or your web browser. Would definitely not recommend wasting your money on this at this point until it can be used to its full potential.
